quest.name: Kindred Spirits
journal: The words of the Vanu shaman yet trouble Sidurgu...

Who better to tell you more of the “great spirit” than those who commune with spirits regularly? For that reason, Sidurgu hopes that the conjurers of Stillglade Fane can offer insight into Rielle's condition. He notes that the road to Gridania will offer many opportunities for the Temple Knights to attack. At the very least, you should be safe as far as Camp Dragonhead.
Suspecting that the Temple Knights are nearby, Sidurgu offers to scout out the road to the Observatorium. Stay with Rielle and follow him at a distance.

Not long after you part ways, the Temple Knights attack, spurring you and Rielle to make haste to the Observatorium. Though the knights are no match for you, their numbers are legion, and you find yourself growing weary from the struggle. However, Rielle's conjury proves surprisingly potent, and you are able to fend off your attackers until you reach the safety of the Observatorium's walls.

Sidurgu chides himself for leaving your side and bids you make haste to Gridania, before the Temple Knights return with reinforcements. Seek out Brother E–Sumi–Yan at the Conjurers' Guild and beg his assistance.

After a cursory examination, Brother E–Sumi–Yan states that the Vanu shaman spoke true, after a fashion. Rielle's innate spiritual presence does indeed bear similarities to that of the elementals─and the Dravanians. Citing an ancient legend in which a man ingested the blood of dragons to become one himself, he speculates that Rielle may have partaken of the blood of an ancient Dravanian. Though Sidurgu is unnerved by the implication, Rielle's feelings are unclear, her face an unreadable mask. Before you embark for Ishgard, Brother E–Sumi–Yan suggests you rest a while at the Carline Canopy.

Frustrated by her silence in the face of Brother E–Sumi–Yan's suggestions, Sidurgu presses Rielle for an explanation. She pauses, and then, with a faraway look in her eyes, she speaks softly of her imprisonment in a windowless cell, with walls so thick she could not even hear the rain. She denies drinking dragon blood, and claims that she was never accused of such. As for their reasons, she intones that her captors simply said, “it's better this way.” Uncertain how to respond, Sidurgu excuses himself and steps outside, leaving you to look after Rielle until she has finished eating.
As you watch Rielle eat, you start to wonder how long she was kept in her cell, and how she passed the time in solitude. Afterwards, she thanks you for waiting and heads outside to find Sidurgu.
Eager to quit the forest, Sidurgu departs with Rielle. Return to the Forgotten Knight and speak with them there.

Blessedly, you and Sidurgu meet with no trouble on the road back to Ishgard. Recognizing that he has yet to adequately recompense you for your services, he resolves to share what knowledge of the dark arts he has with you.

※The next dark knight quest will be available from Sidurgu upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with Sidurgu outside Camp Dragonhead.
Speak with Brother E–Sumi–Yan at Stillglade Fane.
Speak with Rielle at the Carline Canopy.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: So a “great spirit” dwells within Rielle, if that shaman is to be believed...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We need answers, Forename, and I can think of no one better to ask than those who commune with spirits regularly.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I speak of Gridania's conjurers, who can hear the voices of the Twelveswood─or so it is said.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: It's just as well. Fray told me she had an aptitude for their arts. What had taken him moons to learn, she mastered in days.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Sometimes these talents run in the family, he said. Mayhap her ancestors were conjurers after a fashion...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Whatever the reason, there is no guarantee it is related to what the shaman said─or why the Temple Knights wish her dead.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: If past experience is any indication, they will be tracking us the moment we leave the city. It's not a question of if they will attack us, but when...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: But you will be ready for them, I see. Then let us be off. The road should be safe so far as Camp Dragonhead.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We must learn more of Rielle's condition. The conjurers of Gridania will surely have answers.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Are we going to see the conjurers? Fray used to tell me stories of the Fane.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...Sid said he would've won if they had let him keep his staff.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: How much further is it to Gridania? I've never been...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: They're close. I can feel it...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Stay with Rielle. I'm going to scout out the road to the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Follow at a distance. If they come, do whatever it takes to see her safely inside the walls.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Good. That's a promise.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Please be safe, Sid...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...I'm ready, Forename. Whenever you are.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: You're not hurt, are you?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Forename! Thank the gods you're all right!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Gaaah! I should have known they would strike when we were apart...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: They're certain to return with reinforcements ere long. We must press on south, into Gridanian territory.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Until we reach the city proper, we cannot be assured of safety.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: We leave now, Rielle. You can rest once we reach Stillglade Fane.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. You are come to continue your studies?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. How may I be of service?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: ...A “great spirit,” is it? If it please, I would examine this girl myself.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: It is the very least I can do for one who has ever been a friend of the Twelveswood. Ah...but where are they?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Apologies for our late arrival. Rielle grew tired, and I had to carry her part of the way.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I could have kept walking...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Our burdens need not be our own, child. There is no shame in sharing the weight.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Who's the boy?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Aha... I am Brother E–Sumi–Yan, master of this guild. And though you will labor to believe it, young man, I am several times your age.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: You must be Rielle. Forename has told me all about you.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Pray come closer and take your ease. I ask that you close your eyes and listen to my words.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Breathe deep... Feel the myriad life around you... Be as one with the world...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Well?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... The Vanu shaman spoke true, after a fashion.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Her spiritual presence belies her years...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: It is clearly not the product of training, rather an innate power with which she radiates...akin to that of the elementals...or the Dravanians...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: You can't be serious. She's just a girl!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Yes, she is. A very special girl.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Mayhap you are familiar with the tale of the Boy and the Dragon Gay?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Hardly surprising. The archbishop declared it a heretic's tale, and with good cause. It is a corruption of an older legend in which a man partakes of dragon blood and, in so doing, becomes one himself.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Rumor has it that heretics hold such rituals for this very purpose... And if there is truth in such tales...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Perchance she has ingested the blood of an ancient dragon?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: What!? She's not some half-crazed lunatic!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I make no accusations, only offer a possible explanation.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Moreover, who is to say that she did so knowingly?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Y-You...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Excuse me, I...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Ah, pray forgive me! I did not mean to cause you distress.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: You have nothing to fear, my child, for you are in perfect health and blessed with two loyal guardians. Would that others could say the same!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I think Rielle would benefit from a brief respite before returning to Ishgard, unused to the rigors of the road as she is.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Why not show her to the Carline Canopy? An eel pie can do wonders for the soul.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...We thank you for your time.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Such a gentle soul. I can see why he is so fond of her.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Hmph.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Bit premature, isn't it?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Faerie tales and fantasies!? This is what he has to offer us!?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Heretics, I understand, but I expected better from the bloody head of the Conjurers' Guild!

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: And you─why didn't you speak up for yourself?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Rielle!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...There were no windows. Just walls of stone with little cracks to tempt your fingers, and iron bars colder than ice.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I couldn't tell when it was raining─whether it was day or night...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: She didn't say I drank blood. All she said was...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: “It's better this way.”

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: At least, if they catch me, they'll just kill me this time...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...Can I finish my apple?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Go ahead.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...It's not a sin if someone made you do it.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: I didn't.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I won't let them hurt you.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...I know.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...You want another one?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: ...No, thank you.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: ...Right, then.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Keep an eye on her until she's finished eating, would you?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I could do with some fresh air.

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Thank you for waiting with me, Forename. Shall we go and find Sid?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Do you need a moment?

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Well, I've had my fill of the forest.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Back to Ishgard, then. I think Rielle and I can manage on our own for now.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Shall we?

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: The apples were good, but maybe I should've tried the eel pie after all...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: That was a blessedly uneventful journey. Mayhap the Temple Knights were still nursing the injuries you gave them.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: Rielle was worried they might try to ambush you on the road, but I assured her you would be fine...

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I must apologize, Forename. For all you have done for us, I fear I have yet to adequately recompense you.

dialogue.name: SIDURGU
dialogue.text: I will continue to share with you what skills I can. Alas, I fear we near the limits of my knowledge...

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Let's go, then. I don't see anyone...

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT
dialogue.text: There they are! Summon the others!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: They've found us!

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT
dialogue.text: This way, men! After them!

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT
dialogue.text: Surrender the girl! There's no escape!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: Stay back, all of you!

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT
dialogue.text: You are meddling in affairs beyond your ken!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: G-Get away from us! I'm warning you!

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT
dialogue.text: Gah! You'll live to regret this!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: There are the gates, Forename! Just a little further!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: We... We made it! Thank you, Forename, thank you!

dialogue.name: RIELLE
dialogue.text: M-Mother, I...

obj.n: The Knight and the Maiden Fair
